definition: to knock against/to bump into/to have a disagreement/to clash
to tap/to knock (against sth hard)/to knock (mud from boots, ashes from a pipe etc)

sentences.english: People without sufficient EQ will have a hard time in life.
sentences.chinese: 情商不高的人在生活中總是磕磕碰碰。

sentences.english: You begin to come back down to earth with a gentle bump.
sentences.chinese: 輕輕一陣磕碰後，你又回到了現實中。

sentences.english: It's natural to have some bumps in the relationship road to true bliss.
sentences.chinese: 在通往幸福的道路上磕磕碰碰要很自然的事情。

sentences.english: To choose the appropriate space to avoid the bump injured.
sentences.chinese: 選擇適宜的空間進行，避免磕碰受傷。

sentences.english: Fourth, bearing when assembly is not suitable receives the clash and the impact.
sentences.chinese: 第四，軸承在裝配時不宜受到磕碰和衝擊。

sentences.english: Although, wrought iron products are very hard, but also fear knock against.
sentences.chinese: 雖然鐵藝製品都非常堅硬，但也怕磕碰。

sentences.english: Even if get stumbled at one moment, keep the long term communication strategy in mind.
sentences.chinese: 即使一時之間有所磕碰，也應該謹記長期的溝通策略。

sentences.english: Also , diamond jewelry should never be worn while doing heavy work.
sentences.chinese: 並且，在做易磕碰的工作時應摘下鑽飾。

definition: to damage by scratching/to gash/to lacerate
to fall and smash into pieces
to scrape one's car against sth/to sideswipe
to peel off (paint)/(fig.) to be exposed/to lose face (Tw)
to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
to split open/to dehisce (of fruit or cotton bolls, to split open)
to knock/to grasp sth in the hand and beat it/to toughen oneself up
